TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void DataColumnChangeEventHandler(object sender, DataColumnChangeEventArgs e);
.class public auto ansi sealed DataColumnChangeEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub DataColumnChangeEventHandler(sender As Object, e As DataColumnChangeEventArgs)
public delegate void DataColumnChangeEventHandler(System::Object ^ sender, DataColumnChangeEventArgs ^ e);
type DataColumnChangeEventHandler = delegate of obj * DataColumnChangeEventArgs -> unit

param.name: e
param.span: Objeto que contiene los datos del evento.

span.span: A that contains the event data.

summary.span: Representa el método que controlará el evento .

span.span: Represents the method that will handle the event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Cuando se crea un delegado , se identifica el método que controlará el evento.When you create a delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event. Para asociar el evento al controlador, se debe agregar una instancia del delegado al evento.To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. Se llama al controlador de eventos cada vez que se produce el evento, hasta que quite al delegado.The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, until you remove the delegate. Para obtener más información sobre los delegados, vea [controlar y provocar eventos](~/docs/standard/events/index.md).For more information about delegates, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md). > [!NOTE] > La declaración del controlador de eventos debe tener los mismos parámetros que el `DataColumnChangeEventHandler` declaración de delegado.The declaration of your event handler must have the same parameters as the `DataColumnChangeEventHandler` delegate declaration.
